column2: VT DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column4: vehicles
column6: bicyclists
column8: pedestrians

column2: 2. You may not park:
column4: within 200 feet of an elementary school.
column6: in a parking lot.
column8: on a crosswalk or marked bicycle lane.

column2: 3. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are permitted
column6: No right turn
column8: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column6: Right turn is not permitted
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping

column2: 6. If your wheels drop off the pavement onto the shoulder of the road, you should:
column4: maintain your current speed and turn onto the pavement.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop, then quickly turn back onto the pavement.
column8: stop your car on the side of the road.
column10: slow down and carefully turn back onto the pavement.

column2: 7. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 8. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.
column6: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column8: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.

column2: 9. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: change lanes quickly.
column6: increase their following distance.
column8: brake harder than usual.

column2: 10. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column6: merging traffic.
column8: an intersection ahead.

column2: 11. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: only when other vehicles yield.
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column8: Never.

column2: 12. Drowsy drivers:
column4: are at risk of being involved in a crash.
column6: can stay awake by opening a window.
column8: are typically older drivers.
column10: should drink coffee to stay awake.

column2: 13. When changing lanes on an interstate, drivers should:
column4: use cruise control to increase traction whenever possible.
column6: stop in the breakdown lane if they are tired.
column8: signal and check mirrors and blind spots.

column2: 14. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: black
column6: orange
column8: yellow

column2: 15. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 16. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: No trucks allowed
column6: Steep grade ahead
column8: Do not pass trucks

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle parking ahead
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 19. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 20. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
